intro: Helianthella scabra, commonly known as the scaly helianthella, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, scaly leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open grasslands and sagebrush steppe. It has a compact growth habit and produces numerous small, daisy-like blooms. Helianthella scabra is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
